msItemStruct.note: 28 lines written along the fibers on the front; 2 lines along the fibers on the back; papyrus complete

Russian translation on p. 157 of Jernstedt's edition and p. 29f. of Tyraev's edition; German translation in O. von Lemm, Koptische Miscellen 50 (Petrograd 1908; repr. Leipzig 1914), p.1086 (repr. p.[102])

provenance.p: From the collection of N. Likhachov; once housed in the Paleographical Museum of the Academy of Science in St. Petersburg; now in the Hermitage Museum

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

listBibl.bibl: P.HermitageCopt. 70 ed. pr.: B.A. Tyraev, "Achminic Papyrus from N.P. Likhachov's Collection," Notes of the Oriental Department of the Russian Archeological Society [Zapiski Vostochnago otdielenija Imperatorskago russkago arkheologicheskago obshchestva], vol. 18 (1908), 28-30 O. von Lemm "Zu einigen von Turajev edierten Texten, 2-5" in Koptische Miscellen 50 (Petrograd 1908), 1076-1086 (repr. Leipzig 1914, pp.[92]-[102]) Bibligraphical info. on pp. 151-152 of P.HermitageCopt. (= P.V. Jernstedt, Coptic Texts in the State Hermitage Museum [Moscow/Leningrad 1959])
